articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Hyong Jik
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Hyong Jik
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were laid before the statue of Kim Hyong Jik, an indomitable revolutionary fighter and an outstanding leader of the anti-Japanese national liberation movement in Korea, in Ponghwa-ri of Kangdong County, Pyongyang, and before his grave at Mangyongdae on Tuesday, the 118th anniversary of his birth.
					 Wreaths from the dear respected Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, were seen standing before the statue and the grave.
					
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremonies were Kim Yong Nam, Choe Yong Rim and Choe Ryong Hae, members of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 Also present there were senior officials of the party, state and army, officials of the party, armed forces and power organs, working people's  organizations, ministries and national institutions, service personnel, working people and school youth and children.
					
					 Laid before the statue and the grave were wreaths in the name of the C.C., the WPK, the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly and the DPRK Cabinet.
					
					 Also placed there were wreaths in the name of ministries and national institutions, KPA units, revolutionary schools, educational organs and party and power organs, enterprises and farms in Pyongyang.
					
					 The participants paid silent tribute in memory of the immortal feats Kim Hyong Jik performed by dedicating himself to the struggle for the country's independence and the liberation of the proletarians.
					
					 On this day floral tributes were paid to his statues at Kim Hyong Jik Military Medical University and in Sakju County of North Phyongan Province and Junggang County of Jagang Province.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Mongolian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Mongolian President
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj, president of Mongolia, on the occasion of the 91st anniversary of the victory in the Mongolian people's revolution.
					 Kim in the message expressed belief that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the common interests of the two peoples and wished the Mongolian people progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Greets Bahaman PM
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Greets Bahaman PM
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Bahaman Prime Minister Perry G. Christie on the occasion of the 39th anniversary of its independence.
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the future.

articles.title: Anniversary of DPRK-China Treaty of Friendship Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of DPRK-China Treaty of Friendship Observed 
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- A reception was given at Okryu Restaurant in Pyongyang on Tuesday to mark the 51st anniversary of the treaty of friendship, cooperation and mutual assistance between the DPRK and China.
					 It was hosted by the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and the Central Committee of the DPRK-China Friendship Association.
					
					 Present there on invitation were Ambassador Liu Hongcai and staff members of the Chinese embassy in Pyongyang.
					
					 Also attending the reception were Minister of Public Health Choe Chang Sik who is chairman of the Central Committee of the DPRK-China Friendship Association and officials concerned.
					
					 Choe Chang Sik, addressing the reception, said the signing of the historic treaty by President Kim Il Sung and Premier Zhou Enlai laid a legal foundation for boosting the DPRK-China relations in various fields.
					
					 Choe said that the two countries have stepped up socialist construction and constantly developed the friendly and cooperative relations supporting each other in the spirit of the treaty.
					
					 He wished the Chinese people greater success under the guidance of the Communist Party of China led by General Secretary Hu Jintao.
					
					 Liu Hongcai said in his speech that the treaty was signed in the interests of the two peoples to strengthen unity, deepen friendship, promote cooperation and defend peace.
					
					 Despite the complicated international situation, the two parties, governments and peoples have steadily developed the Sino-DPRK friendship through tightened cooperation, he added.
					
					 He expressed belief that the people of the DPRK would register bigger success in building a thriving socialist nation under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation Leaves for Cambodia
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Leaves for Cambodia
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- A DPRK delegation led by Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun left here on Tuesday to take part in the ministerial meeting of the ASEAN Regional Forum to be held in Cambodia and to visit the country.

articles.title: Visits
articles.content:
Visits
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- A DPRK public health delegation led by Vice-Minister of Public Health Kang Ha Guk came back home Tuesday after taking part in a high-level meeting for preparing the 65th Meeting of the Southeast Asian Region of the WHO held in India.
					 The delegation of Economic, Social and Cultural Council of the Council of Ministers of Cambodia led by Yim Nolla, senior minister of Cambodia, went back home on Tuesday.

articles.title: KCNA Delegation Returns Home
articles.content:
KCNA Delegation Returns Home 
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Korean Central News Agency headed by Director General Kim Pyong Ho returned home on Tuesday after attending the 2nd world media summit in Moscow.
					 The delegation was greeted at the airport by KCNA First Deputy Director Kim Chang Gwang and Russian Charge d'Affaries Ad Interim to the DPRK Igor Sagitov.

articles.title: DPRK People Vow Punishment of S. Korean Regime's Hideous Act
articles.content:
DPRK People Vow Punishment of S. Korean Regime's Hideous Act
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- The rat-like Lee Myung Bak group of south Korea again defamed the dignity of the supreme leadership of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 Standing in the van of committing the hideous crime were human dregs affiliated with the "alliance of the elders" and the "society of families of south Korean abductees" in south Korea.
					
					 This provocation has given special edge to the anger of the DPRK.
					
					 Choe Yun Myong, a workshop head at the Kim Jong Thae Electric Locomotive Complex, told KCNA:
					
					 "The Lee group of traitors is getting evermore pronounced in its anti-DPRK campaign. 
					
					 Now is the time to annihilate the group of rats engaged only in committing indelible crimes against the will and desire of all the fellow countrymen.
					
					 Rat-like Lee and his lackeys will soon face a severe punishment by the angry DPRK servicepersons and civilians, who regard it as their life and soul to defend the leadership of the revolution."
					
					 Ryang Chun Sik, a worker at the Tongdaewon Unha Garment Factory, said:
					
					 "Traitor Lee blustered that 'if the north provokes in the future, the south would take several times stronger retaliation' and 'the second Yonphyong Island shelling incident was a premeditated provocation of the north.'
					
					 His bellicose remarks are a token of his desperate effort to avoid the blame for having totally spoiled the north-south relations.
					
					 Lee is now more dead than alive. He had better commit suicide if he does not want to meet harsh retaliation by the DPRK people.
					
					 Those who insulted the dignity of the DPRK supreme leadership are doomed to capital punishment."

articles.title: DPRK People Vow to Destroy S. Korean Regime
articles.content:
DPRK People Vow to Destroy S. Korean Regime
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak group of traitors in south Korea again insulted the dignity of the DPRK supreme leadership.
					 The pro-American conservative group let the "alliance of the elders" and other ultra-right conservative organizations in south Korea and defectors from the north commit such hideous provocation on July 5 when Ro Su Hui, vice-chairman of the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification, was returning to the south after visiting Pyongyang.
					
					 Enraged at another provocation, the servicepersons and civilians of the DPRK vow to destroy the south Korean regime only keen on anti-DPRK confrontation.
					
					 Choe Song Il, vice-president of Koryo Songgyungwan University, told KCNA:
					
					 "The Lee group's repeated provocations are its last-ditch efforts to escape angry south Koreans' criticism and tide over its ruling crisis by escalating the confrontation with the DPRK.
					
					 The south Korean conservative regime has staged such farces whenever it faced with public protest against its sycophantic and treacherous deeds. It should not be left unpunished.
					
					 Now is the time to wipe out the dregs of the nation that spoiled the June 15 era of reunification."
					
					 Paek Yong Sam, an officer of the 2nd Corps of the Korean People's Army, said:
					
					 "Since the Lee group of rats made another provocation, the army and people in the DPRK will burn the group to death with their surging anger.
					
					 It is just the pro-American conservatives that have disturbed peace and brought dark clouds of war to the Korean Peninsula, in league with the U.S. imperialists. Nevertheless, they seek to shift the blame for the escalated tension on to the DPRK, talking about the Cheonan warship case, the Yonphyong Island shelling incident and naval skirmish in the West Sea.
					
					 Like the past provocations, the recent one is aimed to do harm to the undisputed prestige of our supreme leadership and worsen the relations between the north and the south.
					
					 The KPA artillery units will inflict shower of shells on the bases of provocations and the anti-reunification conservative forces involved in the recent provocation."

articles.title: S. Korean Regime's Anti-DPRK Campaign Slashed
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime's Anti-DPRK Campaign Slashed
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak group of south Korea has gone beyond tolerance limit in its anti-DPRK smear campaign.
					 On July 5 the group let human scum to gather near the "Unification Cathedral" in Phaju City, Kyonggi Province and hurt the dignity of the DPRK supreme leadership again, when Ro Su Hui, vice-chairman of the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification, was going back to south Korea.
					
					 The hideous provocation that can be made only by the Lee group was aimed to drive the situation into an uncontrolled phase.
					
					 In this regard, Ro Su Hak, a workshop head at the Pyongyang Printing Factory, told KCNA:
					
					 "The Lee group of south Korea had insulted the DPRK people in mourning over the great national loss. Not content with the thrice-cursed crime, the group is now continuing such reckless action.
					
					 How can we tolerate it? The rat-like Lee group has long become a target of the Korean People's Army."
					
					 He then called for an immediate sacred war of justice to wipe out all the human dregs.
					
					 Kang Un Hui, a lecturer at the National House of Class Education, said:
					
					 "The servicepersons and civilians of the DPRK never pardon any provocation to the dignity of the DPRK supreme leadership, their spiritual mainstay. That is why the successive rulers of south Korea dared not commit such provocation.
					
					 The Lee group should apologize at once, clearly mindful that it is the strong will of the DPRK people to mercilessly wipe out any provocateurs to the last one."  
					
					 Pak U Il, an officer of the Worker-Peasant Red Guards, said:
					
					 "Physical strike is the only way for finally settling accounts with the Lee group of rats. A stern punishment should be given to the human dregs getting hell-bent on the reckless provocation, oblivious of the past bitter defeats.
					
					 The world will witness how the army and people of the DPRK wipe out the group of traitors from this land and build a reunified thriving nation."

articles.title: Months for Maritime Physical Culture in DPRK
articles.content:
Months for Maritime Physical Culture in DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- July and August are months for maritime physical culture in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 Song Yong Myong, an official of the Ministry of General Education under the Education Commission, told KCNA:
					
					 "During the months swimming is most popular.
					
					 In this period intensive swimming teaching is given at indoor and outdoor swimming pools of primary and secondary schools across the country. Teachers are busy teaching schoolchildren how to swim."
					
					 Swimming techniques are also introduced by local TV.
					
					 Swimming pools across the country, including those at Kim Il Sung University, Changgwang Health Complex and Namhung Youth Chemical Complex, are now crowded with people.
					
					 Kim Chol Ryong, a pupil at Pyongyang Primary School No 4, said:
					
					 "I come here the Changgwang Health Complex every day after school.
					
					 I learnt breaststroke last year and I am now learning backstroke. My father, a researcher, and my sister, a student, too, spend time here after their work."
					
					 Swimming is gaining momentum also in the sea, rivers and lakes.
					
					 Hyon Song Hui, a worker at the Pyongyang Thermal Power Complex, said she was planning to go to a beach next week, together with her friends.

articles.title: Pak Jong Suk's Family Enjoys Happy Life in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Pak Jong Suk's Family Enjoys Happy Life in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- A KCNA journalist went to the house of 66-year-old woman Pak Jong Suk on Tuesday to learn about her family's living. Pak had returned home after being taken away to south Korea, allured by its agents.
					 She is now living with her son Kim Jin Myong, daughter-in-law Kim Sin Yong and granddaughter.
					
					 Pak said:
					
					 "During the six-year-long stay in south Korea, I keenly felt how precious my motherland was. The remembrance of my days in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea persistently urged me to go back home.
					
					 When I deplaned in the airport, I was astonished to see officials with flowers in their hands. Then my son, daughter-in-law and granddaughter rushed towards me.
					
					 The warm hospitality made me shed tears. In fact, I would have had nothing to complain even though I was handcuffed.
					
					 The State gave me a new apartment house in Pyongyang to live with my son's family, instead of making an issue of my past wrongdoings."
					
					 Kim Jin Myong said:
					
					 "I had been in distress as the son of a mother who betrayed her country. I felt shame at my mother's betrayal before my fellows, family and society.
					
					 But the State showed loving care for my disgraceful family. Under this care I studied composition at Pyongyang Kim Won Gyun Conservatory and became its teacher after graduation as I wished."
					
					 Kim Sin Yong said:
					
					 "The State offered us this new house, furnished with all living conditions.
					
					 My mother-in-law sat all night on the house-moving day, hardly believing the fact.
					
					 Medical workers come to my home every day to give treatment to her leg wounded in south Korea.
					
					 Our relatives, friends and neighbors frequently call at this house to look after my family's living. I dare say that the best in the world is the Korean-style socialist system centered on the masses where everyone enjoys a happy life without distinction."

articles.title: Solar Water Heater Widely Used in DPRK
articles.content:
Solar Water Heater Widely Used in DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- The Democratic People's Republic of Korea has taken various steps to satisfy the growing demand for energy.
					 Efforts are being made to use such renewable energies as solar heat, wind energy and geotherm while hydro-power stations are built across the country.
					
					 For instance, solar water heaters were installed at houses in newly-built Changjon Street, Pyongyang. This device is not subject to seasons.
					
					 It has already been used in dwelling houses in Nam-ri, Mangyongdae District, and silicate brick apartment buildings in Taesong District, Pyongyang. It is also popular at various units and dwelling houses in local areas including Nampho City and South Phyongan Province.
					
					 The device is produced at the Solar Equipment Development Center.
					
					 Kim Yong Il, director of the Center, told KCNA:
					
					 "The prospect of developing solar energy is very bright in the country.
					
					 The Center has got a lot of experience and rich technical knowledge of this field. It will turn out many solar devices helpful to the improvement of the people's living and protection of environment."

articles.title: Miserable End of Traitor Lee Myung Bak in Offing: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
Miserable End of Traitor Lee Myung Bak in Offing: KCNA Commentary
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak regime of south Korea again defamed the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK, touching off towering indignation among all Koreans. 
					 For several months the Lee group has been busy with the anti-DPRK smear campaign over the Pyongyang visit by Ro Su Hui, vice-chairman of the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification. This confrontation hysteria reached its height with his return to south Korea via Panmunjom as a momentum. 
					
					 Timed to coincide with the arrest of Ro Su Hui who returned to south Korea on July 5 after expressing condolences over the big loss to the nation, the Lee group perpetrated such thrice-cursed act as malignantly hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK. 
					
					 Through this, the Lee group brought to light once again its true colors as confrontation maniac and immoral hooligans that will remain unchanged even after their death. 
					
					 Such hysteria of the Lee group is nothing but the last-ditch efforts of those doomed to death as it is extremely taken aback by the unimaginably tremendous might of Songun. 
					
					 These behaviors of a handful of traitors forsaken by the nation only deepen the DPRK people's conviction of their just ideology, cause and social system and the faith in the final victory. 
					
					 The DPRK has fully displayed its might as the popular masses-centered state which can firmly guarantee the independent dignity and life of the working people under the leadership of the great men of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 The reunification programme common to the nation for the national reconciliation, unity and reunification was provided and its bright prospect could be seen.
					
					 It is quite natural for the traitors and human scum to be utterly indifferent to the dignity and prospect of the nation as money-making, perfidy and betrayal have been the only means of their existence. 
					
					 It is none other than traitor Lee Myung Bak who has done only things harmful to the nation, dead-set against the unity and co-prosperity with compatriots in the north whom all other Koreans and progressive mankind watch with envy. It is shame on the Korean nation that such traitor is allowed to stay among Koreans. 
					
					 The death-bed frenzy of the group of traitors reminds one of the rat-like hoodlums being dragged to gallows. 
					
					 He should bear in mind that the Koreans' final battle to punish the traitors will be beyond human imagination. He will meet the most miserable end which no other traitors recorded in history have ever suffered.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Demands End to Fascist Crackdown upon Patriot
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Demands End to Fascist Crackdown upon Patriot
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- As soon as Ro Su Hui, vice-chairman of the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon), returned to south Korea after visiting Pyongyang to express condolences over the great loss to the nation, the south Korean "government" authorities kicked off a wholesale suppression of pro-reunification patriotic forces, escalating confrontation with compatriots. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday observes in a bylined article in this regard:
					
					 This is a revelation of their sinister intention to tide over their extreme ruling crisis and realize their ambition to stay in power through their fascist suppression of pro-reunification progressive forces.
					
					 This is, at the same time, a treacherous and anti-reunification criminal act to block national reconciliation and unity and escalate the confrontation with compatriots, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 Ro is a patriot who devoted himself to the democratization of south Korean society and the country's reunification. His Pyongyang visit was prompted by his desire to express deep condolences over the greatest loss to the nation and pave the way for the nation's reconciliation, unity and reunification.
					
					 His patriotic deed can never be a target of suppression under any circumstances.
					
					 Through the tyrannical action taken by them against Ro they self-exposed that they are the hooligans who know nothing about the elementary ethics and morality and the worst traitors keen to escalate the confrontation with compatriots, further deteriorate the inter-Korean relations and ignite a war against the north, dead-set against the nation's unity and the country's reunification.
					
					 Patriotism can never fall victim to fascist dictatorship.
					
					 The nation will certainly force the group of traitors to pay a dear price for its crimes.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Discloses Catastrophic Nature of Capitalism
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Discloses Catastrophic Nature of Capitalism 
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- A bylined article of Rodong Sinmun Tuesday deals with the unemployment crisis in capitalist countries.
					 The jobless rate has steadily risen in the capitalist world where everything is at standstill because of serious economic crisis, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 The jobless rate has now reached 11.1 percent in Eurozone and 8.2 percent in the U.S.
					
					 The unemployment crisis getting worsened in capitalist society sharpens all social contradictions, driving the capitalist system into collapse.
					
					 This is eloquently proved by the fact that people from all walks of life staged anti-capitalist demonstrations in protest against poverty and economic inequality in more than 1,500 cities of over 80 capitalist countries last year, shouting "We are 99 percent!" and "Give us jobs!"
					
					 The worsening unemployment crisis pushes capitalist society into a paradise of violence and crimes.
					
					 Those who lost jobs due to the economic crisis are using hallucinogenic and other drugs to relieve uneasiness and fear of existence and despair. Many of them commit suicides.
					
					 It is irresistible that the increasing unemployment rate in capitalist society make many people mentally and physically disabled and turns society into a theater of immorality and depravity.
					
					 Contradiction and antagonism are surfacing in capitalist countries due to the worsening unemployment.

articles.title: U.S. Forces Accused of Treating S. Koreans as Criminals
articles.content:
U.S. Forces Accused of Treating S. Koreans as Criminals 
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- MPs of the Osan U.S. air base in Kyonggi Province treated south Koreans as criminals on July 5, according to south Korean MBC (Munhwa Broadcasting Corporation).
					 Seven MPs rudely behaved towards the owner of a car, even handcuffing him for the mere reason that he parked it before a store around the Osan base. 
					
					 When two south Koreans protested against it, the MPs resorted to violence after handcuffing them. 
					
					 As angry south Korean residents and dealers near the store gathered to denounce the violent act of treating innocent civilians like criminals, they were compelled to hastily free the inhabitants from the handcuffs before fleeing to the base. 
					
					 When south Korean police asked the MPs to appear for the clarification of the case, they arrogantly refused to do so.

articles.title: S. Korean Media Man Praises Changjon Street in Pyongyang
articles.content:
S. Korean Media Man Praises Changjon Street in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Jaju Minbo, a south Korean internet paper, on July 4 posted a letter written by Ri Chang Gi, its  representative, behind bars under the title "Apartment Houses with beautiful curves in Changjon Street in the north."
					 The deepest impression one gets of the skyscrapers and multi-storied apartment houses in Changjon Street of the north reported by media is that many streamlines, circles and other curves were widely used in their architectural style, the letter said.
					
					 Noting this style arouses soft and comfortable feelings, it said that in consideration of profits world famous cities rarely build houses in such a curved way.
					
					 It continued:
					
					 But most of those apartment houses in Changjon Street have diverse curves. One can hardly find such break of rules.
					
					 A glimpse into their style shows that they are the first of their kind in the world in the sense that attention was focused on giving soft and comfortable feelings to people rather than on ensuring economic efficiency.
					
					 Moreover, it is said parking lots are built underground instead of creating them on the ground and its area is covered with parks.
					
					 It is also said shops and service facilities are available underground. It seems that a lot of efforts were directed to designing underground space in the light of the fact that they have many windows so they may admit sunlight.
					
					 Anyhow, it is certain that Pyongyang is such a city where architects can design any house to people's convenience.
					
					 It is my wish to see the day when designers in the south side would be able to join hands with the architects in Pyongyang to lay out a city to be proud of in the world.
					
					 Such fashionable apartment houses are available for Pyongyang citizens free of charge. How marvelous it is?

articles.title: S. Korean Lee Myung Bak Group of Traitors Accused of Its Reckless Anti-Reunification Acts
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Accused of Its Reckless Anti-Reunification Acts
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- The North Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration in its statement on Tuesday accused the Lee Myung Bak regime of south Korea of its shuddering crackdown upon Ro Su Hui, vice-chairman of the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon), who went back to south Korea via Panmunjom after expressing condolences over the great loss to the nation.
					 There is no reason for Ro to be subject to crackdown as his Pyongyang visit was not only expression of a due courtesy to share sorrow with the north Koreans as a compatriot but a righteous and heroic action prompted by the patriotic desire to achieve national reconciliation and unity and bring earlier the country's reunification by efforts of the Korean nation, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 The puppet fascist group, however, pounced upon the aged pro-reunification patriotic champion who crossed the demarcation line in Panmunjom like a horde of mad dogs and committed an unethical violence which would make even an animal blush. Not content with this, they made no scruple of handcuffing him like a criminal and binding him up to put into custody.
					
					 The group of traitors is mulling persecuting Ro on charges of violation of the notorious "Security Law" while openly disclosing its undisguised attempt to stamp out all the progressive organizations for reunification movement of south Korea including the Pomminryon South Headquarters.
					
					 This clearly proves that "human rights", "democracy" and "co-existence and co-prosperity", lip-service of the group, are nothing but hypocrisy and sophism to cover up its despicable traitorous, unpopular and anti-reunification nature.
					
					 The group is facing an irrevocable and serous ruling crisis due to its hideous crimes committed before the nation. Now it is making desperate efforts to seek a way out in escalating confrontation with the DPRK to the extremes, kicking up the madcap racket for "eliminating the forces following the north" and establishing the sycophantic and treacherous military nexus with outsiders.
					
					 The more the group of traitors makes desperate efforts, the fiercer the south Koreans will become in resisting it.
					
					 The June 15 joint declaration, a signpost of reunification, reflects the faith and will of all Koreans that can be oppressed neither by handcuff nor by bayonet.
					
					 All the Koreans are sure to mete out a stern punishment to traitor Lee Myung Bak, a pro-U.S. and pro-Japanese lackey, keen on fascist dictatorship and confrontation with fellow countrymen.

articles.title: S. Korean Paper Accuses Japan of Its Desperate Moves to Emerge Military Giant
articles.content:
S. Korean Paper Accuses Japan of Its Desperate Moves to Emerge Military Giant 
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- The south Korean paper Asian Economy on July 7 commented on Japan's stepped-up moves to turn it into a military giant as evidenced by its campaign to bolster its capability for military espionage against its neighboring countries as follows:
					 The Japanese government presented a report claiming the right to collective self-defence, which was echoed by the political camp.
					
					 It indicates that Japan is rapidly turning to the Right as it means an attempt to modify the attitude which has been hesitated in consideration of uproar from neighboring countries.
					
					 The Japanese government has sought the expansion of the long-range operations of its military forces, occasioned by the enlargement of the sphere of its "Self-Defense Forces" on the basis of redefined U.S.-Japan alliance.
					
					 To this end, it decided to introduce mid-air refueling tankers, large transport ships, escort craft, new type transport planes, etc in the new mid-term defense capability readjustment plan for 2001-2005 confirmed in December, 2000.
					
					 Last year it decided at a ministerial meeting its "defense policy" in the direction of increasing investment in latest type weaponry including submarines, fighters, etc. This is aimed at increasing the maneuverability of the SDF, strengthening naval watch and bolstering its missile defense capability.
					
					 A report provided by a verification team of the Defense Ministry said in order to gather information about the "missile launch of north Korea" independently Japan would examine the use of information about the launch provided by early warning satellite of the U.S. forces and "the deployment of Aegis in waters near the launching site while cooperating with U.S. Aegis." 
					
					 The report claims this action is aimed at gathering "information about missile launch" but it is interpreted as achieving such a military purpose as expanding the radius of the SDF's actions.
					
					 It is expected that the deployment of Aegis in the West Sea of Korea would make the escalation of military tension such as the aggravating containment between the U.S., Japan and south Korea and China and Russia in waters of the West Sea unavoidable.
					
					 The Japan Defense Ministry plans to import two drones from the U.S. and deploy them at the GSDF.
					
					 It is expected to independently develop drones. It said that once unmanned spy planes are developed and their technical level rises, the ministry is expected to use them for a military purpose.
					
					 Security and intelligence satellites will be reinforced to monitor military facilities in the north. Japan lifted off spy satellite "Optics 3" in 2009. In December, 2011 it blasted off rocket "H-2A" No. 20 which delivered "Radar 3".
					
					 If "Radar 4" and "Optics 5," etc, are launched as scheduled, Japan will have a complete system for photographing specified land spots more than once every day.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Carried by Tanzanian Paper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Carried by Tanzanian Paper
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- The gist of the dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "On Effecting a Drastic Turn in Land Management to Meet the Requirement for Building a Thriving Socialist Nation" was carried by the Tanzanian paper Uhuru on June 30.
					The work, published on April 27, 2012, deals with the undying feats President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il performed for land management.
					
					 It also indicates the general orientation and tasks to facelift the country's land as befitting a socialist thriving nation.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Remembered Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Remembered Abroad
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Remembrance meetings were held by the Communist Party of Tajikistan, the Swedish Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Multi-commodity Co. of Indonesia on July 3 and 4 to commemorate the 18th anniversary of the demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Present at the meetings were people of various circles in those countries.
					
					 Kurbonzyon Mirzoyeva, member of the Presidium of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Tajikistan, said it is 18 years since the President demised, adding:
					
					 The President enunciated the idea of global independence including the establishment of fair international relations based on independence and conducted energetic activities for its materialization.
					
					 He sincerely helped people of various countries in their national liberation struggle and worked heart and soul for the development of the non-aligned movement.
					
					 The august name of the President and the undying exploits performed by him for global independence will always be remembered by humankind.
					
					 Oskar Molleby, chief of the Swedish Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, recalled that the President led the Korean revolution for a long period, building a socialist power independent in politics, self-supporting in the economy and self-reliant in national defence. 
					
					 The director of the Indonesian company noted that the President was a great man who built a socialist country in Korea and made untiring efforts for the reunification of the country.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Praised by Romanian Political Party, Brazilian Organization
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Praised by Romanian Political Party, Brazilian Organization
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- A Romanian political party and a Brazilian organization posted special write-ups on their Internet homepages on the occasion of the 18th anniversary of the demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The Socialist Party of Romania posted on its homepage an article titled "Eternal reverence" on July 4 with a photo of the President meeting former U.S. President Carter.
					
					 The article said the President was a peerlessly great man who was deeply respected by the progressive people generation after generation, adding more than 100 preparatory committees were organized throughout the world to celebrate the centenary of his birth, the Day of the Sun, as a significant holiday common to humankind.
					
					 On the Day of the Sun this year, many people around the world presented gifts to the President and wrote and published books, articles and poetic works to laud him, it said, adding that events took place in various countries in celebration of his birth anniversary and media of the world gave wide publicity to them.
					
					 The Brazilian Committee for Solidarity with the DPRK on July 2 posted on its homepage an article titled "Kim Il Sung, model of international cooperation" illustrated with a portrait of smiling President.
					
					 The article said the President deeply respected by the world progressives set an example of genuine cooperation in international relations.
					
					 The President was the great father of progressive humankind, it noted.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Il Sung's Demise Commemorated in Myanmar, Benin
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Il Sung's Demise Commemorated in Myanmar, Benin 
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- The Yangon Regional Committee of the Union Solidarity and Development Party of Myanmar sent a floral basket to the DPRK embassy in Myanmar on July 5 on the occasion of the 18th anniversary of the demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Ali Houdou, general secretary of the Socialist Party of Benin, sent a bouquet to the DPRK embassy in Cotonou on July 4.
					
					 Saying the President was the most prominent leader and peerlessly great man in the 20th century, he prayed for his immortality.
					
					 Only victory and glory are in store for the Korean revolution as it is led by the dear respected Kim Jong Un, he added.

articles.title: Foreign Organizations Support Korean People's Effort for National Reunification
articles.content:
Foreign Organizations Support Korean People's Effort for National Reunification 
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Foreign organizations in their statements on July 3 and 4 supported the Korean people in their effort for national reunification.
					 The Ecuador-Guaranda Institute for Friendship and Cultural Solidarity with the Korean People noted that the July 4 Joint Statement was published thanks to the painstaking efforts and wise leadership of President Kim Il Sung, who devoted himself to national reunification.
					
					 It stressed that the great feats the President and General Secretary Kim Jong Il performed for national reunification would last forever.
					
					 The France-Korea Friendship Association supported the historic statement and reiterated its will to conduct positive activities to support the Korean people in their just cause of independent and peaceful reunification of the country. 
					
					 The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy and the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea fully supported the effort of the Korean people for achieving national reunification on the Three Principles of National Reunification, set forth by the President, under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Il Sung's Demise Commemorated in Nigeria
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Il Sung's Demise Commemorated in Nigeria
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Nigerian figures visited the DPRK embassy in their country on June 29 and July 4 to commemorate the 18th anniversary of the demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 They placed bunches of flowers before a full-length painting showing the President and General Secretary Kim Jong Il standing together, before paying tribute to them.
					
					 Among them were Ibrahim Mantu, chairman of the Nigerian National Committee for Remembering President Kim Il Sung, member of the Credit Committee of the People's Democratic Party of Nigeria and chairman of the Nigeria-Korea Friendship Association, Alhassan Mamman Muhammad, chairman of the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, and other people.
					
					 Ibrahim Mantu noted that it is the obligation and duty of his organization to pay tribute to the President on the occasion.
					
					 The President instilled confidence in victory and courage into the world oppressed people, he said, adding:
					
					 We will widely introduce the greatness of the President and the DPRK among Nigerians and thus positively contribute to the development of the friendly relations between the two countries.
					
					 Alhassan Mamman Muhammad said that the President was a genuine father of the people as he ushered in the new era, an era of independence when the popular masses emerged masters of their destinies and makers of history, and provided a unique socialist system centered on the popular masses in the DPRK.
					
					 The Korean people will surely accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche as they are under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un who is identical to the President and Kim Jong Il, he added.

articles.title: Peruvian Organization Slams Japan's Moves for Territorial Expansion
articles.content:
Peruvian Organization Slams Japan's Moves for Territorial Expansion 
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- The Peruvian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism released a statement on July 3 in denunciation of Japan's moves for territorial expansion.
					 The statement accused Japan of creating instability and escalating tensions in East Asia, betraying its wild ambition for territorial expansion.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 It is ridiculous and disgraceful for Japan to distort the recommendation in which the United Nations Commission on the Limits of the Continental Shelf noted it did not agree with Japan's proposal on extending its continental shelf, and insist that Okinodori was recognized by it as an islet. 
					
					 Japan has not yet abandoned its wild ambition for territorial expansion but persistently pursued it, far from drawing a lesson from its defeat in World War II.
					
					 The world progressive people who love justice and peace will never allow Japan's such ambition and moves for militarization.

articles.title: Rinden homenaje a Kim Hyong Jik con motivo de su nacimiento
articles.content:
Rinden homenaje a Kim Hyong Jik con motivo de su nacimiento
Pyongyang, 10 de julio (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 118o aniversario del nacimiento de Kim Hyong Jik, destacado dirigente del movimiento antijapones de liberacion nacional de Corea e indoblegable combatiente revolucionario, fueron depositadas este martes las ofrendas florales ante su estatua de bronce erguida en la comuna Ponghwa del capitalino distrito de Kangdong y su tumba en Mangyongdae.
					Estaban colocadas en respectivos lugares las ofrendas florales enviadas por Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea.
					
					En las ceremonias para colocar las ofrendas, participaron Kim Yong Nam, Choe Yong Rim y  Choe Ryong Hae, miembros del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del PTC.
					
					Ademas se distinguian los cuadros directivos del partido, el Estado y el ejercito, los funcionarios de las instituciones del partido, el Poder, las organizaciones de masas, los ministerios y organos centrales, los oficiales y soldados del Ejercito Popular de Corea, los trabajadores, los jovenes y ninos escolares.
					
					Fueron depositadas las ofrendas florales en nombre del CC del PTC, el Presidium de la APS y el Consejo de Ministros, de la RPDC.
					
					Se colocaron las otras en nombre de los ministerios, organos centrales, unidades del EPC, escuelas revolucionarias, instituciones docentes, las organizaciones del partido y el Poder, las empresas y las granjas en esta capital, entre varias unidades.
					
					Los participantes guardaron un momento de silencio en memoria de las imborrables proezas de    Kim Hyong Jik quien dedico todo lo suyo en la lucha por la independencia del pais y la liberacion de masas proletarias.
					
					El mismo dia, fueron depositados las ofrendas y ramos florales a pie de las estatuas de bronce de  Kim Hyong Jik erguidas en Academia de Sanidad Militar Kim Hyong Jik, el distrito de Sakju de la provincia de Phyong-an del Norte y el distrito de Junggang de la provincia de Jagang.

articles.title: Premier coreano felicita a su par bahamese
articles.content:
Premier coreano felicita a su par bahamese
Pyongyang, 10 de julio (ACNC) -- El premier coreano Choe Yong Rim envio este martes un mensaje de felicitacion a su homologo bahamese, Perry G. Christie con motivo del 39o aniversario de la independencia de Bahamas.
					En su misiva, el remitente manifesto su conviccion de que se intensificaran y se desarrollaran aun mas tambien en el futuro las relaciones de amistad existentes entre ambos paises.

articles.title: Comite norteno condena la represion contra Ro Su Hui
articles.content:
Comite norteno condena la represion contra Ro Su Hui
Pyongyang, 10 de julio (ACNC) -- El Comite Norteno para la Ejecucion de la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio hizo publica el dia 10 una declaracion para condenar la represion violenta de la banda del traidor Lee Myung Bak contra el vicepresidente de la Direccion Surena de la Alianza Pannacional por la Reunificacion de la Patria, Ro Su Hui, quien regreso al Sur de Corea via Phanmunjom luego de expresar condolencias por el gran duelo nacional.
					La visita a Pyongyang del vicepresidente devino una cortesia para compartir la tristeza con los connacionales norcoreanos y acto justo que partio del deseo patriotico de reproducir la epoca de Entre nosotros, los connacionales para lograr cuanto antes la reconciliacion y unidad nacionales y la reunificacion, subraya el documento y continua:
					
					Por eso, no hay ninguna razon para ser objeto de represion.
					
					Sin embargo, en cuanto Ro cruzara la linea divisoria de Phanmunjom, la banda de titeres fascistas arremetio sobre ese anciano patriota y partidario de reunificacion y lo arrestaron esposando la mano y amarrando el cuerpo como si el fuera delincuente.
					
					Ahora, la camarilla surcoreana trata de enjuiciar a Ro en virtud de la infame "ley de seguridad" y, a la larga, expone abiertamente el intento de exterminar la Direccion Surena de la APRP y otras entidades progresistas del movimiento por la reunificacion del Sur de Corea.
					
					El hecho demuestra que los "DDHH", la "democracia" y la "convivencia y coprosperidad", de que hablan tanto los traidores surcoreanos, no pasan de ser embuste y sofisma para disimular su naturaleza antinacional, antipopular y anti-reunificacion.
					
					Ellos cayeron ahora en la irremediable crisis de gobernacion por sus tremendos crimenes cometidos ante la nacion coreana y buscan la salida en el enfrentamiento extremado entre ambas partes coreanas, la "purga de las fuerzas pro-Norte" y la cooperacion militar vendepatria con las fuerzas extranjeras.
					
					Mientras prosigan las acciones desesperadas de ellos, creceran cada vez mas las olas de protestas de la poblacion surcoreana.
					
					La Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio, jalon de reunificacion, es la conviccion y voluntad de todos los coreanos que no se puede doblegar ni con bayonetas.
					
					Toda la nacion llevara sin falta al tribunal de la historia al traidor Lee, enloquecido en la dictadura fascista y la confrontacion fratricida y enviciado de servilismo a EE.UU. y Japon, y lo condenara a castigos severos.
